title.narrative: Protection Monitoring and Multi-Sectoral Response in the selected Local Government Areas (LGAs) in Borno State.

description.narrative:
The rainy season has augmented to challenges in the delivery of humanitarian assistance in Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) sites. thereby further widening the unmet protection gaps. The rains have caused flooding of many sites resulting in IDP shelters being damaged or destroyed, thus overcrowding in higher ground and loss of personal dignity. Further, IDPs have also suffered loss of basic items including food. The effect has been that IDPs in trying to cope with their new situations are more exposed to protection risks including physical safety risks due to stagnant water, violence, abuse, family separation, exploitation, sexual harassment and trauma.
This project will address protection gaps worsened in North East Nigeria following the rainy season. Key response activities proposed include
Protection Monitoring including referrals – Identification of cases that require further follow up and/or referral to specialized services for effective response by protection staff. Capacity building of protection stakeholders for proper identification, effective protection mainstreaming, and response to protection challenges including referrals. Vulnerability screening – will be implemented through effective profiling of displaced population which will enable targeted response for persons with specific needs who are in most need, urgent or immediate protection response. Enhance Community based protection – through effective use of community protection framework including Protection Action Group (PAG) members to identify and respond to protection concerns. Construction of three (03) Protection Desks (PDs) to provide a platform to effectively coordinate and mainstream protection interventions, provide referral point of all protections issues as well as initial point in mapping of protection intervention from the camp/community level. Provision of Non-Food Items (NFIs) to reduce risk and address needs as a protection intervention to most vulnerable individuals of concern. Improved physical safety through the installation of solar lighting system.
The project will be implemented in Borno State Dikwa, Damboa, and Gwoza-Pulka LGAs) and Adamawa State (Mubi LGAs). The specific locations will include IDP camps and host communities in each of the listed locations. Beneficiary households and individuals will be identified through vulnerability screening and protection monitoring among the IDPs in camps/or communities of concern, as well as through referrals from humanitarian partners in the areas of operations/service provisions.
In total 45,000 IDPs (5,000 households) will be targeted. This project will be implemented with the support of UNHCR’s partner GISCOR in Borno State, and a national partner who will be selected for Adamawa State. The partners will be supported by the community-based protection structures already established in the camps/or communities
